​ @IGCSEStudyBuddy  can you make videos for PHYSICS revision as well??
Glad I could help!

Neurons use electricity within themselves but switch to chemicals at the synapse to bridge the gap between them and send messages to the next neuron.  So the chemical part of neural communication happens in the tiny gap called the synaptic cleft where neurotransmitters are released and bind to receptors on the receiving neuron's surface.

@IGCSEStudyBuddy  So does that mean between all neurons there are synapses, and so the electrical impulses change to chemicals for diffusing into the next neuron?   Also thank you for responding so fast.
That is correct 👍🏻
@IGCSEStudyBuddy Okay, thank you.
